import atriya from "../assets/atriya.jpg"; import "./Founder.css"; export default function Founder() { return ( <>
{/* PHOTO SECTION */}

Shri K. V. Atriya

Founder President — The Brigade Education Trust

Education is not information — it is human engineering.
{/* TEXT CONTENT */}
{/* HIGHLIGHT GRID */} {/*
Post Graduate in English
Bachelor’s in Education
Bachelor’s in Commerce
PG Diploma in Environment Protection Mgmt
PG Diploma in Industrial Relations and Personnel Mgmt
PG Diploma in Journalism — Gold Medalist
*/} {/* TIMELINE (CLEANED) */} {/*
1998–2016 Worked across CBSE, AP Board, Gujarat Board, ICSE and ISC as TGT, PGT, Administrative Officer, Principal, Secretary and Correspondent.
Defence Hostels Superintendent, Sainik School Balachadi, Ministry of Defence, Government of India.
2016–17 Led School Management Committee Training across 1797 Government school complexes covering 2,09,235 members for Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, Andhra Pradesh.
Research Blind peer reviewer for Arizona State University; published in IJIRMF and International Journal of Indian Psychology.
Talks Delivered talks at All India Radio and Doordarshan on Education and role of Teachers.
Training Former National Trainer at Sri Sathya Sai Vidya Vahini; active trainer in Human Values Education in Telangana.
*/} {/* FULL PROFILE */}

Shri K V Atriya is a Post Graduate in English, holds Bachelor’s degrees in Education and Commerce, and multiple Post Graduate Diplomas including Environment Protection Management, Industrial Relations and Personnel Management, and Journalism in which he received the Sri Vasudev Rao Aurangabadkar Memorial Gold Medal by Bhartiya Vidya Bhavan. He belongs to a rare professional category whose work experience spans Government and Private service, School and Higher Education, classroom teaching, faculty training, educational development programs, and research. An educationalist, researcher and analyst, he has worked across CBSE, AP Government Board, Gujarat Board, ICSE and ISC institutions, and in the Ministry of Defence at Sainik School Balachadi. His leadership in School Management Committee Training across 1797 Government schools in Andhra Pradesh impacted 2,09,235 members. His research and publications address learning outcomes, employability skills, neuroscientific studies, and educational quality. He has delivered talks at All India Radio and Doordarshan, served as National Trainer with Sri Sathya Sai Vidya Vahini, and is an active trainer in Human Values Education in Telangana. He has cultivated a deep understanding of Gandhian principles, Nai Talim, and Swami Vivekananda’s educational philosophy, advocating for an Indian ethos blended with contemporary research to enhance learning and teaching effectiveness.

Shri K V Atriya is a Post Graduate in English, holds a Bachelor’s in Education and in Commerce, a Post Graduate Diploma in Environment Protection Management, a Post Graduate Diploma in Industrial Relations and Personnel Management and a Post Graduate Diploma in Journalism in which he was conferred with Sri Vasudev Rao Aurangabadkar Memorial Gold-Medal by Bhartiya Vidya Bhavan (2001) He belongs to a rare professional category whose work experience range from Government Service to Private Service, School Education to Higher Education, from a regular service to Independent Service, from classroom teaching to faculty training, from a formal teaching/training to Educational Community Development Programs with research as his passion An Educationalist, researcher and analyst, he worked across Boards viz., CBSE, AP Govt Board, Gujarat Govt Board, in ICSE/ISC as a TGT, PGT, Administrative Officer, Hostels Superintendent in Sainik School Balachadi, Jamnagar, GJ, Min. Of Defence, Govt Of India, as Principal, as Secretary & Correspondent as part of his regular service from 1998 to 2016. Further, he lead School Managament Committee Training in 1797 Govt schools’ complexes spread across in all 348 Mandals of 06 Districts of AP, covering training for 2,09,235 SMC elected and nominated members as per Govt. records (2016-17) for Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (now Samagra Shiksha), Ministry of Human Resource Development, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh as Training Head & Project Co-ordinator. He is well versed with the educational history and philosophy of India including NEP 2020 with special inclination towards teaching, learning standards & learning outcomes. His research work includes reviewing articles, commentaries, literature review as part of blind peer review process of Current Issues in Education, Arizona State University, USA (2009-2015) & recent publications (2025) include “Bridging the Gap Between Academic Achievement and Employability: A Case Study of Soft Skills Integration in some Rural and Semi Urban Mandals of West Godavari District, Andhra Pradesh” ,  International Journal for Innovative Research in Multidisciplinary Field, ISSN(O): 2455-0620, Vol-11, Issue-6, Pp.378-389. Available on –   https://www.ijirmf.com/ and “Cross-Domain Brain Activation in Learning: A Neuroscientific Study of an Extramural Combination of Co-Scholastic Competencies to Enhancing Educational Quality and Inclusivity in Rural Public Schools of Vikarabad District of Telangana State. International Journal of Indian Psychȯlogy . 13, 3 (Sep. 2025). https://ijip.in/ His talks on “Importance of Education at the All India Radio and “ Role of Teachers in Education” at Doordarshan Kendra, Ranchi in 1997, were very popular. He was among the national trainers for Sri Satya Sai Vidya Vahini-a training program to mitigate urban and rural divide in quality education, part of a holistic program run by Sri Sathya Sai Seva Organizations. (2011-13) He is active faculty trainer in the engazement of Sri Satya Sai Seva Organization with the Govt of Telangana in imparting training on Human Values in Education/Teaching. He has cultivated a distinctive understanding of Gandhian principles of Truth, ahimsa and the ‘Nai Talim’ system of education and Swamy Vivekananda’s philosophy of education and learning. He advocates for an educational approach that resonates with the Indian ethos blended and backed by contemporary research that enhances the effectiveness of learning-teaching processes at par with Global standards.
